org.primaresearch.clc.phd.repository.search

Class LabellableObjectFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.primaresearch.clc.phd.repository.search.LabellableObjectFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Filter

    public class LabellableObjectFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filter
    Filter for objects that have labels.
    Author:
    clc

      • filterObjects

        public java.util.List<HasLabels> filterObjects(java.util.Collection<HasLabels> toBeFiltered)
        Returns a list of all objects from the input list that apply to this label filter. Also refreshes the counts of the internal filter elements (number of objects per label).
        Parameters:
        toBeFiltered - Input objects
        Returns:
        A new list

      • countObjects

        public void countObjects(java.util.Collection<HasLabels> objectsWithLabels)
        Refreshes the counts of the internal filter elements (number of objects per label).
        Parameters:
        objectsWithLabels - Input objects

      • filterAndCountObjects

        private java.util.List<HasLabels> filterAndCountObjects(java.util.Collection<HasLabels> toBeFiltered,
                                                        boolean doFilter)
        Returns a list of all objects from the input list that apply to this label filter. Also refreshes the counts of the internal filter elements (number of objects per label).
        Parameters:
        toBeFiltered - Input objects
        doFilter - If set to false, the filter is not applied to the input list
        Returns:
        A new list

      • filterAsGroup

        public boolean filterAsGroup(java.util.Collection<HasLabels> objects,
                             java.lang.Object groupParent)
        Checks a group of objects if they go through or are filtered out all together.
        Parameters:
        objects - Group of objects with labels
        Returns:
        True if the group would go through and not be filtered out

      • checkGroupForOneLabel

        private boolean checkGroupForOneLabel(java.util.Collection<HasLabels> objects,
                                      java.lang.String labelTypeToUse)
        Checks if at least one member of a group of objects has a specific label.
        Parameters:
        objects - Group of objects with labels
        labelTypeToUse - Label type ID
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the given objects has a label of the specified type

      • countAsGroup

        public void countAsGroup(java.util.Collection<HasLabels> objects,
                         java.lang.Object groupParent)
        Updates the counters for all label types Should be used in conjunction with resetCounts()
        Parameters:
        objects - Group of objects with labels

      • isLabelTypeSelected

        public boolean isLabelTypeSelected(LabelType labelType)
        Returns the selection state of this filter for the given label type.
        Returns:
        true if this filter does let through objects with the given type; false if objects are filtered out.

      • setLabelTypeSelected

        public void setLabelTypeSelected(LabelType labelType,
                                 boolean selected)

      • isLabelTypeEnabled

        public boolean isLabelTypeEnabled(LabelType labelType)
        Returns the enabled state of this filter for the given label type.
        Returns:
        true if enabled; false otherwise.

      • getObjectCount

        public int getObjectCount(LabelType labelType)
        Returns the number of objects with the given this filter lets through.
        Returns:
        Number of objects from last count (calls to filterObjects or countObjects). Returns -1 if the label type is not covered by this filter.

      • resetCounts

        public void resetCounts()
        Sets the count of each filter element to zero.

      • initLabelFilterElements

        private void initLabelFilterElements(LabelType labelType,
                                     LabelFilterElement parent)
        Recursively creates filter elements for the given label type and its children

      • getRootLabels

        public java.util.Collection<LabelGroup> getRootLabels()
        Returns the root label types of this filter (other label types are ignored when applying the filter).

        Initialises the filter (filtering should let through all objects)
        Parameters:
        allWorkflows - Unfiltered list of objects
